column4: Can anyone please assist me with setting up SoundBlaster Audigy2 on ubuntu 7.04 x86_64
whats the issue your having?
well i cant get sound working on my distro
basically autodetect = no sound
which distro, have you tried anything to make it work yet?
probably just the volumes need setting
i can do the ADC
in the package manager select "aumix" and install it, it's quite a nice mixer. use that to set all the sound levels up untill you hear stuff
sorry all voer the place: one big reply: autodetect not working, ADC works, but not for all apps (such as firefox + flash)
what is adc?
so you do have some sound then.. what exactly is not working?
Multichannel playback also gives sound, but low quality
basically not all aps work with the sound configurations
sorry, for more advanced sound setup I don't know anything really. not a sound man myself :)
doh!
check the alsa wiki out, it's a treasure trove
http://alsa.opensrc.org/Main_Page
those will tend to be generic instructions though.. not ubuntu specific
meh why not, ive tried forms already :)
http://alsa.opensrc.org/Sound_cards your card is listed there near the top
from the link i showed you it would seem that that card does not have much more support than that which you already have
hmmm...
